title: Special incentive for migrant worker remittances for New Year

title: Sri Lanka Inches Closer to IMF Aid Option After Rupee Plunge
snippet: The country's dollar bonds due July 2022 gained 1.6% on Wednesday to halt five days of losses, while the rupee advanced 0.3% a day after plunging as much as 12% -- the most in more than four decades -- in reaction to the central bank's announcement that it was letting the currency float as international reserves dwindle.

title: Rise in global oil prices to impact fuel imports to Sri Lanka
snippet: The rise in global oil prices will impact the importing of fuel to Sri Lanka, Energy Minister Gamini Lokuge said today. He said that fuel stocks purchased under the Indian credit line, is expected to arrive in Sri Lanka after 15th March.

title: Import of 367 non-essential goods into Sri Lanka restricted
snippet: The importation of 367 non-essential goods into Sri Lanka has been restricted. Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa issued a gazette permitting the import of 367 non-essential goods into Sri Lanka only with a valid licence.

title: Sri Lanka faces near 4 hour power cut on Thursday
snippet: Sri Lanka's power regulator announced power cut of up to 3 hour and 45 minutes for Thursday in all parts of the country between 8am and 11pm due to inadequate supply of fuel for thermal power generation.

title: At Colombo Security Conclave, India calls for close cooperation to tackle trafficking, transnational crime
